definition[0]: to show or tell people about a new product or plan for the first time
example[0]: The club has unveiled plans to build a new stadium.
definition[1]: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony
example[1]: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
definition[2]: to inform people about something, especially financial results or a new product
example[2]: Yesterday the bank unveiled a soaring 28 percent rise in profits for the year to December.
example[3]: They have unveiled a new series of multimedia products, including a double CD-Rom with an interactive game.
